page.title: 19YEAR 1914
page.content: My grandma started work at thirteen. She earned a weekly wage of 7/6d (37p) working at a mill doing woollen piecing in a mill at Priest Royd Mills. The working hours were: 6:30am - 8:30am 9:00am - 12:00am 12:45pm - 5:30pm Washday consisted of soaking whites the night before in a powder called Lovley Polly. Boiled water was taken from the fireside to the tub in an enamel jug. Being lucky to have a tub you then rinsed dry using a mangle. Washing took a full day and ironing took another. Washing powder 2d Soda 2d There was no such thing as sliced bread. Families had to bake teir own bread and that was another days job.
